title: Problems with League
body:
So i've been having trouble with my lol client i have tried repairing, re installing and god knows what else. i cant seem to get the game to work no matter what i do. this only just happened since the new patch 

help plz

replies.body:
Ok my friend figured it out unistall league and download the installer. Before u click 'Finish' got to ur little arrow that points up on ur task bar. near ur date and time then press the up arrow got u what ever anti virus u have right click and turn it of. then click finish ll should lunch fine

in short 
1. download league installer of website
2.follow the commands
3. The last page will have something like "lauch lol" and Finish TURN ANTIVIRUS OFF BEFORE CLICKING FINISH
4. click finish lol should start up.
5. leave antivirus off until lol is finished updating/downloading
6. feed


IF U DONT WANT TO UNISTALL LOL then close LOL and restart ur PC then simply turn off ur antivirus and launch lol

Hope this helps be carefull with ur antivirus being off <3 <3 <3 :3

Hey NeonHearts,

Can you provide some more details about the issue you're encountering?

> 2. Disable any firewalls and/or antivirus applications that you may have running. These firewalls may block outbound and inbound League of Legends connections, causing some serious problems and preventing you from getting on the Rift! For help disabling your firewall(s), check out [**this article**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq3).
> 3. Disable IPv6, as the League of Legends client is designed to work with IPv4. For help disabling IPv6, check out [**this article**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq4).
> 4. Configure your DNS to use a public Domain Name System. For help configuring your DNS settings, check out [**this article**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq5).
> 5. If possible, try port forwarding the League of Legends ports. For a list of the ports that League of Legends uses and more information on how to set up port forwarding, check out [**this article**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq8).
> 6. Check for VPN and proxy usage. If necessary, [**reset your Internet Explorer settings**](http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/internet-explorer/reset-ie-settings). 
> 7. Disable IP Helper. To do this, open the start menu, search "services", and select "Services.msc" or "Services" (depending on operating system). Locate IP Helper, right-click on it, and select "Properties". On the properties page, select "Startup type" and select "Disable". Under "Service status", click on "Stop" and then apply the settings. 
> 8. Now, lastly, [**flush your DNS and release/renew IP**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq10).

all of the above and also i have tried to reinstall nothing seems to be working.



when i open the luncher the lol logo appears then quickly dissappears. The luncher and Patcher are running in my processes. After waiting about 45minutes it comes up with a blank and just says error. 

also when i reinstall the game the installer downloads but the game wont lunch after the installer has been downloaded
